notes.reading-notes:
SAMPLE NOTES ON READING PASSAGE
TOPIC: section from university catalogue on admission to engineering major
procedures for admission to engineering major:
take all prerequisites
get minimum average of 3.0, or B, in prerequisites
apply by April 1
see if admitted on June 1 (only some are)
notes.listening-notes:
SAMPLE NOTES ON LISTENING PASSAGE
TOPIC: student discussion of section from university catalogue
main points of discussion:
woman seems clear about what it takes to be admitted to engineering major (knows need B average to apply but maybe won't be admitted)
man seems unclear about what it takes to be admitted to engineering major (thinks need B average to be admitted but only half of those with B average are actually admitted)

check-list.item-text: I noted the main points of the reading passage.
I noted the main points of the listening passage.
I used careful planning to outline my response.
I began with an overall topic statement.
I used transitions to connect the supporting ideas.
